page.title: 09EDUCATION IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: Long before the National Schools a former Rector and his daughter ran a school in the Rectory barn,but now the village no longer has its own school. It closed about five years ago when there were only 23 children: now there are a few more children of primary school age but there is no chance of re-opening the school as the building was sold and the schoolyard is now used for dog-kennels. School bus services take children to the primary school in Holt, and the secondary school in Sheringham. The pre-school playgroup is well supported by Edgefield mothers but depends on the availability of private cars. A few of the older children go to independent schools in Holt or Norwich or at 16+ to the Norwich City College: a private bus service is now supplying transport at suitable times.
